data.title: The Beast Must Die
data.text:
The Beast Must Die (1974, UK) is a Werewolf film directed by Paul Annett.

Contents: Watch Trailer | Review #1 | Blu Ray | Available DVDs | Review #2 | Poster Art | Fun Facts

Featured in: The Amicus Collection (3 DVD) | The Amicus Collection (BluRay)

Featured on: TCM Underground

LISTEN TO RADIO SPOT https://www.grindhousedatabase.com/index.php/File:Beast_Must_Die.ogg

Main Details

Released in 1974

Color

Running Time: 93 Min.

Production Co: Amicus Productions | British Lion Film Corporation

Distribution Co: Cinerama Releasing Corporation (1974) (USA) (theatrical)

Directed by Paul Annett

Written by Michael Winder, Paul Annett, James Blish, Scott Finch

Starring Calvin Lockhart, Peter Cushing, Marlene Clark

Produced by John Dark, Robert H. Greenberg, Max Rosenberg, Milton Subotsky

Original Music by Douglas Gamley

Cinematography by Jack Hildyard

Film Editing by Peter Tanner

Plot Summary

Eight people have been invited to an island estate for the weekend. One of them is a werewolf. Can you guess which one?

Also Known As

La Bestia debe morir (Spain)

Black Werewolf (USA) (video title)

Cinq griffes dans les ténèbres (France) (video title)

Mondblut (Germany)

Le Mystère de la bête humaine (France)

La Notte del licantropo (Italy)

Pedon on kuoltava (Finland)

Tagline

One of these eight people will turn into a werewolf. Can you guess who it is when we stop the film for the WEREWOLF BREAK? See it ... solve it ... but don't tell!
